value.title: Researchers Look to Expand Automatic Speech Recognition to 2,000 Languages
value.excerpt: A team of researchers at Carnegie Mellon University is looking to expand automatic speech recognition to 2,000 languages. As of right now, only a portion of the estimated 7,000 to 8,000 spoken languages around the world would benefit from modern language technologies like voice-to-text transcription or automatic captioning.
